item.title: Daily Briefing - 2026-02-18
item.description:
**Morning Briefing**
**1) What Changed Since Yesterday** Global markets remain stable. U.S. futures show slight gains. Oil prices are up due to ongoing supply concerns. Earnings reports are coming in mixed.
**2) Venezuela Update** Venezuela's opposition is set to discuss plans for upcoming elections. Talks with the government continue, but no formal agreements have been reached. Humanitarian aid discussions are also underway.
**3) UK Response Signals** The UK government has issued a new statement on energy policy. Focus is on boosting renewable sources. Further regulations for fossil fuel investments are expected. Mixed reactions from industry leaders.
**4) Legal/Docket Watch (Epstein-related)** None.
**5) What to Watch Today** Watch for upcoming economic data releases, including U.S. jobless claims. Key earnings reports from major tech firms will be released. Monitor developments in Venezuela's election discussions. Keep an eye on any new UK energy regulations.
End of briefing.
